title: Course of Action Analysis for Maritime Chokepoint Transit
description: A naval planner must compare two COAs for a fleet to transit a dangerous maritime chokepoint: a high-speed transit vs. a slower, more deliberate transit with enhanced ISR.

tasks.description: Develop plans for both the high-speed transit and the deliberate transit COAs.
tasks.expected_outcome: Planner creates two distinct and viable transit plans.

tasks.description: Assess the risks for each COA, considering threats from shore-based missiles, mines, and small boats.
tasks.expected_outcome: Planner accurately assesses that high speed reduces exposure time but limits reaction time.

tasks.description: Recommend the slower, deliberate transit, as the enhanced ISR provides better situational awareness to counter potential ambushes.
tasks.expected_outcome: Planner makes a well-justified recommendation prioritizing security over speed.
